The Story:

KARPA (Kerbal Advanced Research Projects Agency) has teemed up with the KSC to develop a hypersonic glider vehicle that will be controllable, easy to use, and will be mounted on top of a rocket.

The Challenge:

The KSC wants YOU to build the glider (and the rocket) and post a download of the .craft file.

The Rules:

-It must look like the real-world DARPA falcon HTV-2

-It must be SUB-ORBITAL (no orbital weapons systems)

-It must be a glider (no engine; only the velocity gained from the carrier rocket and good old fashioned gravity)

-It must be completely stock

-It must be controllable and be able to be steered, banked, pitched, and rolled a minimum of 90 degrees on the NavBall

Extra Challenge:

-Use it to destroy the VAB

As far as I can see:

The Rules:

-It must look like the real-world DARPA falcon HTV-2

-It must be SUB-ORBITAL (no orbital weapons systems)

-It must be a glider (no engine; only the velocity gained from the carrier rocket and good old fashioned gravity)

-It must be completely stock

-It must be controllable and be able to be steered, banked, pitched, and rolled a minimum of 90 degrees on the NavBall

Extra Challenge:

-Use it to destroy the VAB

There is exactly one part we have that looks anything like that - the Mk2 cockpit - so that's the "glider".

Sub-orbital = any old launch-vehicle (no sub-orbital weapons either).

Glider = so nothing needs to be added to the cockpit.

Stock = it's a cockpit.

Controllable and be able to be steered ... = SAS will take care of that as it plummets out of the sky.

Destroy the VAB = by crashing into it, which is neither useful nor interesting.

So - Mk2 cockpit, decoupler, some low-powered rocket, done.
